sub_title: Voluntary Emergency Preparedness & Response Coordination at Home
summary:
Since August 2015 back in the Netherlands, a welcome break from Humanitarian Development and focussing on the development of my daughter. Now that she turned 18, looking again on the horizon for possible opportunities in the Humanitarian Sector, If possible from my current location in Deurne, The Netherlands.

I hold a Master Degree in Land and Water Management (Land Resource Management Option) with more that 18 years of progressively increasing management responsibilities in developing countries (Uganda, Sudan, Afghanistan and Pakistan). Project/Program Management experience in the field of Water & Sanitation, Public Health, Food Security, Livelihood, Emergency Response, Coordination and implementation of Quick Impact/Local Government Development Projects. 

I have provided flexible, high-level management resources to field and technical teams as needed. Gained practical implementation k knowledge of Financial, Grants Management Support, Logistics and Procurement systems. An ability to adapt to new program requirements and able to work in a multi cultural and hardship environments, easily establish harmonious and effective working relationships, good interpersonal and communications skills. 

Available for Short Term Emergency Support

Specialties: Programme management, planning and representation, Land & Water Management, Water Supply and Sanitation, Land Resource Management, Soil and water conservation and water harvesting, Project cycle management, Proposal preparation and budgeting, Disaster response planning and coordination, Donor liaison, Participatory approaches
